txt.en:
'I came forth from Aughaire intending to halt the spread of hill-beasts further into Fasach-larran, [placeholder], but the creatures are too many.

'If you are deserving of the friendship of the Trév Gállorg, you will aid me with my charge. North-west of here, you will find a sloping path into Nád Nathair. It is a place of menace, and from there come the hill-beasts that prowl Fasach-larran.

'Defeat many of the hill-beasts you find there, and we will speak again when you return.'
'You have defeated a number of hill-beasts? I am glad to hear it, for now we may proceed with the next step in our hunt.'
'The slopes of Nád Nathair are north-west of here. Climb them and defeat as many hill-beasts as you can, and I will think of some way we can fight them more effectively.'
'You found my brother? That is good, but you must aid Tasgall in his campaign against the hill-beasts if you are to earn my recommendation to Crannog!'
Tasgall has tried to halt the spread of hill-beasts throughout Fasach-larran, but the creatures are too numerous for him to manage alone.

Hill-beasts stalk the slopes of Nád Nathair to the north-west of Tasgall's camp-site, in Fasach-larran.\n\nTasgall has asked you to defeat many hill-beasts while he thinks of some way to resist them more effectively.
Tasgall's camp-site is north of Aughaire and south-east of Nád Nathair.\n\nYou have defeated many hill-beasts and should now return to Tasgall.
